name: Hardest Bizarre Products Trivia Quiz | World | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'Sinkems' are brightly colored paper cutouts of boats, ducks, etc. What are they for?
options: Light them on fire and they explode
Scattering in the pool for parties
questions.explanation:
Toilet training little boys.

	Ready, aim, fire... need I say more?

questions.text: Which of these bizarre products was featured in a Skymall (airline) catalog in 2003?
questions.explanation:
Electric tongue cleaner.

	Gives a new meaning to the threat of washing your mouth out with soap, eh? Of course, some of your fellow passengers on the plane probably need this...

questions.text: What is the 'Mayfair Majesty', a product sold by Bemis?
options: A velvet painting of the Pilgrims
A device that will read romance novels out loud
questions.explanation:
A king-sized toilet seat.

	It might sell well with Sinkems for the big boy in your life...

questions.text: A popular holiday gift in Europe is a small man made from marzipan--almond paste. What is bizarre about this man?
questions.correct: He has a coin inserted in his rear end
options: He wears a really big hat made of sugar
questions.explanation:
He has a coin inserted in his rear end.

	It's supposed to bring prosperity, somehow.

questions.text: Stupid.com is a great repository of bizarre products. One of these is a large piece of fudge in a real baby diaper. What is this delectable treat called?
Another fine product from stupid.com is a small label-gun. What is it designed to print messages on?
questions.explanation:
Bubble gum.

	I guess you can inscribe clever witticisms like 'Eat me'.

questions.text: Pet supply catalogs offer a plethora of pitiful products. Which of the following is real?
options: Cat T-shirts with the logo 'Addicted to Catnip'
questions.explanation:
Dog ear cement.

	Some dogs, like Collies and Shetland Sheepdogs, are supposed to have a bend in the tip of their ears. This product 'trains' the ears.

questions.text: A popular product at the Archie McPhee online emporium of weird stuff is an action figure- of whom?
questions.explanation:
Jesus.

	The site adds 'Note- cannot walk on water'.

questions.text: A popular item on both the stupid.com and Archie McPhee websites is a culinary tool. What is it?
questions.correct: A telescoping fork that can be up to 2 feet long
options: A device to detect spoiled milk
questions.explanation:
A telescoping fork that can be up to 2 feet long.

	It's called the 'Freeloader Fork' and you supposedly can sneak a bite of your neighbor's dessert with it.

questions.text: The granddaddy of all bizarre products! Which avian ornament is required for the bizarre lawn?
questions.explanation:
A pink flamingo.

	I have no idea why.
